headline.main: SUBMARINES SINK 5 JAPANESE SHIPS; Destroyer, Tanker and 3 Cargo Craft Swell U.S. Undersea Total of Victims to 148 SUBMARINES SINK 5 JAPANESE SHIPS

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 -- The total number of Japanese ships sunk or damaged by American submarines rose to 148 when the Navy today announced that our undersea craft operating in Pacific combat waters had sent five more enemy vessels to the bottom and damaged two others, one of which may have been sunk.
abstract: Jap destroyer, tanker and 5 cargo ships sunk by US submarines, Pacific combat waters; 2 cargo ships damaged, 1 believed sunk; total US submarine toll of Jap ships reptd; Adm Nimitz awards Navy Cross to 9, Silver Star to 5, DFC to Ensign J H Reid, Air Medal to 1 and Navy and Marine Corps Medal to 5

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
